result.execSummary:
The defendant Arnold S Castro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 6 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through Petition by Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Arnold S Castro in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant, who wants to accept offer. State advises of details of offer. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Arnold S Castro in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of previous activity, advises that Defendant made appointment but never showed up, was sent offer, called their offer on Sunday, call was returned during business hours. State reviews offer. Court questions Defendant who has questions about offer. Defendant wants time to think about it.  Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Arnold S Castro in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with DA. State advises that Defendant never made an appointment. Defendant didn't make appointment, lost job due to failed drug screen, never called to get any information. Court may find that Defendant has waived right to attorney if he doesn't meet with DA before next hearing. Discussion regarding whether Defendant may qualify for PD.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Arnold S Castro in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on how he wants to proceed regarding Counsel. Defendant wasn't able to get in touch with an attorney this week, wants to waive his right to Counsel to speak with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Discussion regarding Defendant's employment/income/dependents. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Arnold S Castro in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews citations, previous activities. Defendant said there was a misunderstanding with the paperwork, some citations said he didn't have to come in. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court reviews options regarding Counsel. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant Arnold S Castro not in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews citations issued to Defendant, orders bench warrant.
